instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01326: What is 820-01326? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01326</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image after water damage
threads.message:
I have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01326</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> little bit water damaged but no image on screen.
Working on the external screen.
Water damage on LVDs cable, i did a Diode mode reading, can't find any short. It maybe the MUX but i don't have a donor board, it is the same of <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ?
Also Is the lcd the same of <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> to test the motherboard ?
Thanks for the help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01326</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image after water damage
threads.message:
Try using 01041 schematic.

GMUX, maybe video connector/cable damaged too.
Replace all them and you can test with <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01326</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no image after water damage
threads.message: Where i can get another gmux? Is it the same <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> ?
